result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Melanie R. Casper

records.addlTxt:
8:55 AM Attorney Daniel Joseph Tombasco in court for State of Wisconsin. Defendant Melanie R. Casper in court.  Attorney John Anthony Ward in court for Melanie R. Casper. Clerk N. Nobile.
MINUTES: Court addresses the motion for judge to recuse filed by Attorney Ward. For reasons set forth on the record Court denies motion. Attorney Ward is requesting an adjournment as he needs additional video/audio discovery. The State does not object. Court adjourns.
Final pre-trial scheduled for December 15, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
*NN 10/18/22*

For Judge to Recuse Herself
Submitted by Atty John Anthony Ward

10:43 AM    Attorney Dan Tombasco appeared for the State. Defendant, Melanie R. Casper, appeared with Attorney John Anthony Ward.  Clerk N. Nobile.
MINUTES: Attorney Ward is requesting an adjournment as the State recently made an offer and he would like additional time to review it with the DE. Court adjourns.  Final pre-trial scheduled for October 13, 2022 at 09:00 am.
to Preliminary Hearing
Judicial Pretrial - in court on September 1, 2022 at 10:30 am.

107PM  Assistant District Attorney Daniel Bernard Deida appeared for the State.  Defendant appeared in court in person and w/ Attorney John Anthony Ward.   Clerk JT  Minutes: Defendant waives preliminary hearing. Probable cause found. Bound over to Br. 3. Information filed today, receipt acknowledged, reading waived. Not guilty plea(s) entered.  Judicial Pretrial - in court scheduled for September 1, 2022 at 10:30 am. Bond continued posted w/ same conditions (see bond entry). mi

Pre-trial conference scheduled for September 1, 2022 at 10:30 am.
Atty Bielski is unavailable for prelim on 7/7/22 and requests hearing be set over for status at 1:00 PM on 7/7/22 and court approved the request.
